slides.title: What is Chemical Engineering?
slides.content:
# Scaling Up ‚öóÔ∏è

Taking reactions from a test tube to a factory.
- Converting raw materials into useful products.
- Fuels, Plastics, Medicine, Food.

slides.title: Process Flow Diagrams (PFD)
slides.content:
# The Map üó∫Ô∏è

Schematic of the plant.
- Shows reactors, pipes, valves, sensors.
- Used to design and control the process.

slides.title: Chemical Reactors
slides.content:
# Mixing Pot üç≤

Where the magic happens.
- **Batch Reactor**: Fill, cook, empty (Pharma).
- **CSTR (Continuous)**: Flow in, flow out continuously (Oil Refineries).
- **Plug Flow**: Pipe reactor.

slides.title: Mass Transfer
slides.content:
# Moving Molecules üöö

Movement of specific ingredients.
- **Distillation**: Separating liquids by boiling point (Alcohol/Fuel).
- **Filtration**: Separating solids from liquids.
- **Extraction**: Pulling a chemical out using a solvent.

slides.title: Heat Transfer in Process
slides.content:
# Temperature Control üå°Ô∏è

- **Heat Exchangers**: Transferring heat from hot fluid to cold fluid without mixing them.
- Essential for safety (prevent explosions) and efficiency.

slides.title: Process Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which process separates liquids based on their boiling points?

slides.title: Thermodynamics in ChemE
slides.content:
# Energy Balance ‚öñÔ∏è

- How much energy does the reaction release (Exothermic)?
- How much energy must we add (Endothermic)?
- Optimizing energy use saves millions.

slides.title: Fluid Dynamics
slides.content:
# Pumps and Pipes üöø

Moving goo around.
- **Viscosity**: Thickness (Honey vs Water).
- **Reynolds Number**: Turbulent (messy) or Laminar (smooth) flow.
- Sizing pumps correctly.

slides.title: Catalysts
slides.content:
# Speed Boost üöÄ

Substance that speeds up reaction without being consumed.
- Industrial gold.
- Makes processes cheaper and faster.
- Example: Catalytic converter in cars.

slides.title: Polymer Engineering
slides.content:
# Plastics üß¥

Creating long chains of molecules.
- **Thermoplastics**: Melt & reshape (PET bottles).
- **Thermosets**: Burn if heated (Tires).
- Tailoring properties (hard, soft, stretchy).

slides.title: Process Control
slides.content:
# Automation üéõÔ∏è

Using sensors and computers to keep the plant safe.
- Maintaining Pressure, Temp, Flow.
- Alarms and emergency shutdowns.

slides.title: Safety (HAZOP)
slides.content:
# Safety First ü¶∫

- **HAZOP**: Hazard and Operability Study.
- "What if this valve fails?" "What if power cuts?"
- Chemical plants have layers of protection.

slides.title: Separation Processes
slides.content:
# Pure Product üíé

We usually make a mess, then clean it up.
- **Crystallization**: Making sugar/salt.
- **Chromatography**: Precision separation (Medicines).
- **Membranes**: Reverse Osmosis (Desalination).

slides.title: Reaction Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What do we call a reaction that releases heat energy?

slides.title: Biochemical Engineering
slides.content:
# Bio-Factories ü¶†

Using living cells (yeast/bacteria) to make products.
- **Fermentation**: Beer, Yogurt.
- **Insulin**: Made by modified bacteria.
- Growing meat in labs.

slides.title: Petrochemicals
slides.content:
# Oil Legacy üõ¢Ô∏è

Refining crude oil.
- Fractionating column separates Diesel, Petrol, Jet Fuel.
- Basis for almost all modern plastics.

slides.title: Food Engineering
slides.content:
# Tasty Tech üç´

- Pasteurization (Safe milk).
- Freeze drying.
- Flavor encapsulation.
- Shelf life extension.

slides.title: Green Engineering
slides.content:
# Clean Up ‚ôªÔ∏è

- Designing processes with less waste.
- Using renewable feedstocks (Bio-plastics).
- Carbon Capture.

slides.title: Chem Eng Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **Reactors** make it.
- **Separators** clean it.
- **Scale** makes it cheap.
- Everything you touch (Phone case, Shirt, Shampoo) passed through a ChemE.
